customer_name: Three Star Farm and Fruitstand LLC

citations.narrative:
The facility is conducting regulated activity without a valid USDA license. The facility is engaging in exhibition of covered
species including multiple parrot species, cockatoos, macaws, pigeons, parakeets, pheasants, quails, multiple waterfowl,
poultry, multiple domestic hoof stock, ostrich and emus. There are approximately 350 animals that have been identified at
the facility that would require a USDA license for exhibition. Failure to obtain the required license with USDA prevents the
Secretary from determining compliance with the Animal Welfare Act to ensure humane treatment of covered animals. No
person shall operate as a dealer or exhibitor without a valid license.
Correct by discontinuing covered activity until a USDA License has been obtained.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
Additional Inspectors:
HARVEY KENT, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

narrative:
2.1(a)(1) 
   
Requirements and application. 
The facility is conducting regulated activity without a valid USDA license. The facility is engaging in exhibition of covered 
species including multiple parrot species, cockatoos, macaws, pigeons, parakeets, pheasants, quails, multiple waterfowl, 
poultry, multiple domestic hoof stock, ostrich and emus. There are approximately 350 animals that have been identified at 
the facility that would require a USDA license for exhibition. Failure to obtain the required license with USDA prevents the 
Secretary from determining compliance with the Animal Welfare Act to ensure humane treatment of covered animals. No 
person shall operate as a dealer or exhibitor without a valid license. 
 
Correct by discontinuing covered activity until a USDA License has been obtained. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
HARVEY KENT, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
